newsitem.title: USA: Creative Technology gets preliminary injunction.
newsitem.headline: Creative Technology gets preliminary injunction.

text.p: Creative Technology Ltd, said Thursday that it and its U.S. subsidiary, Creative Labs Inc, have obtained a preliminary injunction in their lawsuit against Cyrix Corp and certain OEM customers of Cyrix's Media GX chip.

Creative Technology said the lawsuit, filed March 17 in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California, alleges that Cyrix and its Media GX customers are misleading consumers as to the capabilities and the source of the computer audio solution provided by the Cyrix Media GX chipset.
Creative said its amended complaint asserts claims of false advertising, trademark infringement, copyright infringement and unfair competition.

It said in the preliminary injunction, the court endorsed Creative's false advertising claims and ruled that Cyrix and the Media GX customers cannot advertise Media GX based systems as being Sound Blaster compatible. The court also endorsed Creative's copyright claims and enjoined Cyrix from further distribution on its Internet Web site of Creative's software drivers and applications, Creative said.

It said the court took under further consideration what preliminary relief it would enter on Creative's remaining trademark infringement claims. Rulings on such claims are expected in the near future.

The defendants may, in the interim, continue to ship Media GX hardware, which the court preliminarily found does not in-and-of-itself cause inaccurate references to Creative or its trademarks, Creative said.
